--- --- # 📜 Land of Shadows - Quest Session I ##

The Border Between Reality and Nightmare

You are unconscious, trapped in the darkness between distorted dreams and reality. On the outskirts of the Shadow Lands – a strange space where the glory of the former Golden Empire is slowly being consumed by darkness – you are awakened by the cold touch of an unfamiliar woman. Water made from the Empire's holy water is splashed on your face, and as faint fragments of memory swirl in your mind, you return to reality, realizing you are a stranger here. The platinum-blonde knight who appears before you introduces herself as Ottilie and proposes accompanying you to survive in this cursed land.
--- --- "...Wake up... Hurry..." Cold water splashed on your face rouses your dazed consciousness. As you open your eyes, your blurry vision focuses on a platinum-blonde woman leaning over you, her expression worried. A faint blue light emanates from her armor, seeming to push back the grotesque darkness surrounding you. "Thank goodness, you're alive. Lying unconscious here is an invitation to death." She carefully helps you sit up. Looking around, you seem to have been lying among the ruins of a collapsed stone building. Parts of the building still stand, but most of it is in ruins, and the statues carved into the walls are warped into forms that seem to scream. This place appears to have been an old pilgrims' shelter. The sky is a bizarre swirl of unnaturally red mist and green clouds, and though lightning flashes occasionally, an eerie silence envelops the space, with no sound at all. In the distance, three moons of different sizes and colors illuminate the darkness. "My name is Ottilie von Wittelsbach. Of the Augustus Knightly Order... no, a former knight." She gives a short laugh and touches a medal pinned to her chest. The medal bears the mark of the Augustus Knightly Order, but its edges are engraved with symbols of penance. "I don't know why you collapsed here... but it's a miracle you're alive, especially near the Shadow Lands." She examines your condition, then takes out a small leather pouch and places it in your hand. Inside are clean water and dried jerky. "This place is the 'Broken Pilgrims' Shelter.' It was once a sanctuary for pilgrims journeying to Augustus. Now, it's become one of the most dangerous areas on the outskirts of the Shadow Lands. Soon, when darkness fully falls, more demons and undead will appear." Before she finishes speaking, strange groans echo from afar. Indistinct shadows begin to move among the trees. "They're already waking up... We need to get moving." Ottilie draws a holy sword named 'Bellatrix' from its scabbard. The sword seems to emit its own faint blue light, illuminating the surroundings. "I was on my way to the 'Silent Cathedral' to carry out a mission... no, penance. It's said that demons have hidden an ancient scroll there." She seems lost in thought for a moment, then continues with determination. "I don't think I can reach the cathedral alone. If you accompany me, I can guide you out of these outskirts to a safe settlement. What do you say?" In the distance, a twisted tower rises into the sky, with red mist swirling around it. Ottilie points towards it and says: "That's the 'Silent Cathedral.' It was once a center of the Augustus faith, but now it's a den of demons. If we find information there, I'll help you too." Whether you accept her offer or seek another path is up to you. Either way, survival in this distorted reality will require strength and wisdom. And perhaps an ally like Ottilie. There are several paths on the outskirts of the Shadow Lands. You could head towards the Silent Cathedral, or to the ruins of a small village visible in the distance. Or you could choose an entirely different direction. Each choice will come with its own risks and rewards. Whatever journey you embark on, the Shadow Lands are watching your every move.

--- --- # 📜 Land of Shadows - Exploration Session ##

Beneath the Ashen Veil, a Twisted Frontier

As you regain consciousness, a desolate wasteland unfolds before your eyes, beneath a somber, ashen sky devoid of any sign of life. The pungent stench of decay and the bizarrely twisted flora make you instinctively realize that this is no ordinary world. Like venom seeping from a colossal wound, a sinister energy from beyond permeates the air, heavily oppressing the outskirts of the Shadow Lands. You have been cast here by an unknown force, and now, amidst this despairing landscape, you must find a path forward.
--- --- With a splitting headache, you gasped for breath and opened your eyes. Your last memory was of a void filled with chaos, and the maw of a rift that seemed to suck everything in. The overwhelming energy you felt beyond it seemed to have flung you into this unfamiliar place. As you tried to rise, a searing pain shot through your joints, accompanied by a deep exhaustion. The ground beneath you was damp and cold, and underfoot, decaying branches and unidentifiable substances crunched unpleasantly. Lifting your head to look around, only a hopelessly desolate landscape filled your vision. The sky hung low, an eternal ashen gray, and the land beneath it was stained a morbid red or gray, devoid of any warmth of life. The intermittent wind carried not just a simple chill, but an insidious dampness that seemed to seep into your skin, along with the nauseating smell of rot. The air that filled your lungs with each breath was heavy and foul, and fine dust, or perhaps some harmful spores, irritated your throat. You seemed to be at the edge of a grotesquely twisted forest. The trees were all blackened, their branches contorted skyward as if frozen mid-writhe in agony, like living creatures. Leaves were scarce, but those you saw were covered in dark reddish spots, like the diseased skin of an animal, or possessed a strange, metallic sheen. Unnamed mushrooms and moss grew insidiously on the ground, some emitting a faint glow or looking as if they would burst with a noxious fluid if touched. Far in the distance, beyond the horizon where the forest ended, an even denser and more ominous darkness seemed to lurk. A thick fog, like a living curtain, concealed what lay beyond, but the overwhelming malice and chaotic energy emanating from it could be felt on your skin. A grim premonition crossed your mind that this might be the very 'Shadow Lands' spoken of in hushed, terrified tones. This place was merely the horrifying outskirts; true despair surely lay beyond. Occasionally, unsettling sounds broke the silence. A bizarre cry from afar, whether from beast or something else, you couldn't tell; a scraping sound you initially mistook for branches rubbing in the wind but was somehow unnatural; and even the sound of something skittering rapidly beneath your feet. All of this constantly kept your nerves on edge. Your entire being screamed a warning that this was by no means a safe place. As you scanned your surroundings more closely, your eyes caught what faintly resembled the traces of a path. It was almost obliterated from long disuse, but a clearly man-made trail wound through the dark reddish undergrowth. It was barely worthy of the name 'path,' but in this wasteland, it seemed like the only sliver of civilization to be found. Whether it led deeper into the heart of the Shadow Lands or away from it, you couldn't tell. Suddenly, very far away, almost at the limit of your vision, you spotted a small, intermittently flickering light. It was so faint you wondered if it was a trick of the eyes, but as you squinted and focused, you could clearly see a tiny light blinking in the darkness. Whatever it was, it was the only sign suggesting the presence of life. But whether that light was a beacon of hope or a prelude to further danger, you couldn't know. In this grim land, you instinctively understood that reckless optimism would only invite death. Occasionally, old, broken, and moss-covered piles of stones caught your eye. Perhaps they were once small outposts, or maybe roadside shrines. Stone tablets that might have borne the Empire's insignia were now so weathered as to be unrecognizable, or were covered in sinister black cracks. This seemed to be silent proof that order and civilization had once existed here, but were now utterly forgotten and decayed. This place, the outskirts of the Shadow Lands, was like a condensed vision of the world's end. This land, which might have once prospered under the glory of the Empire, had now transformed into a place filled only with death, despair, and unknown horrors. You had no idea why you had come here, nor what you should do next. Only one thing was certain: to survive, you had to move. Your body still felt heavy and pained, but your survival instinct overwhelmed your reason, urging you onward. You had to escape this hellish place, or at least find somewhere safer than your current position. Rummaging through your pockets, you found, besides your own belongings, a small, light coin purse. Your memories were still a confused jumble, and even your own identity felt faint. Several choices lie before you. You could follow the faint trail deeper into the Shadow Lands' frontier, or in the opposite direction. You could risk everything and cautiously approach the distant flickering light. Or, instead of moving immediately, you could meticulously explore your surroundings for clues about this desolate region, or perhaps secure a safe hiding place, however temporary. Beneath the ashen sky, the dangers and mysteries of this twisted land await your decision.

--- --- # 📜 Navarro del Mar - Exploration Session ##

Contracts and Trades, the Sea Where Gold Flows

In the murky fog of Puerto Harbor, you open your eyes. Having arrived in the coastal city of Navarro del Mar for unknown reasons, you sense darkness hidden behind wealth. The harbor bustling with merchant ships and traders, the Gold Guild where power games unfold, and secrets traded in the shadows. To survive in this city, you need wisdom and perception. In this land where the saltiness of the sea and the smell of blood mix, your fate depends solely on your choices.
--- --- On a morning when golden sunlight scatters diamond-like fragments across the sea, you regained consciousness at the dock of Puerto Harbor. Your head was throbbing and your body covered in salt, but memories of how you got here were as hazy as fog. The last thing you remember is a scene of your ship wrecking in a violent storm. Now, by some strange twist of fate, you have arrived at the port city of Navarro del Mar, one of the wealthiest territories in the Empire. Puerto Harbor was the heart of Navarro del Mar. This massive port, dominating the western coast of the Empire, boasted a size capable of accommodating hundreds of ships simultaneously. Despite the early morning, the harbor was already pulsating with vibrant energy. Amid the constant coming and going of trading vessels of various sizes and shapes, the air was filled with the shouts of workers unloading cargo and the sharp cries of seagulls. As you stood up from the dock, workers around you looked at you with suspicious eyes. Their faces showed signs of being tanned by the sun along with wariness. Rather than rejection of an outsider, their gazes contained sharp calculations about "the value this person holds." "You're alive, stranger." An elderly man in a white shirt and blue vest approached you. His hands, roughly trained by the sea, were covered with thick calluses on each joint. "When the rescue ship found you, you were half dead. Seeing how the sea spat you out, it seems fate hasn't abandoned you yet." He introduced himself as Marcos, the deputy captain of Puerto Harbor, an individual overseeing the daily operations of the port. "You're not the first to drift into this harbor. But arriving alive on the coast means you were lucky." Marcos's voice carried a solemnity born from experience. He pulled a small leather pouch from his pocket and handed it to you. "This was found in your clothes. There's not much money, but it should last you about a day. In Puerto Harbor, it's hard to survive long without money. Here, they say 'gold flows like water,' but there are also many who thirst for it." As you looked around, the outline of the city was clearly visible beyond the harbor. Bright-colored buildings with terracotta roofs rose in terraces along the hills, and at their center, magnificent trade guild buildings stood tall as if flaunting the city's wealth. On a distant hill, the majestic fortress of Count Ricardo Navarro del Mar overlooked the entire city. But you could also sense darkness hidden behind this splendor. In the narrow alleys around the harbor, suspicious transactions were taking place, and in the shadows where even the golden sunlight couldn't reach, another face of the city was hiding. The true essence of Navarro del Mar, concealed behind its beautiful exterior, was a dangerous game board where gold and blood mixed. "Hurry if you have somewhere to go. If not..." Marcos pointed to a building with red lanterns near the harbor. "Try 'The Red Anchor Inn.' The innkeeper Rosa is picky, but she sometimes helps foreigners looking for work. Oh, and if you go to 'Merchant's Square' north of the harbor, you can get information about this city. There's also the 'Library of Gold Coins' operated by the Merchant Guild." Marcos looked at you for a moment and added in a low voice: "And be careful. In this city, everything is subject to trade. Even your life." With his warning behind you, you are now about to take your first steps in Navarro del Mar. The sea breeze from the harbor carried the smell of salt along with exotic spice fragrances, and from a distance came the shouts of merchants and the sound of bargaining. In this city where wealth and danger coexist, your fate now depends solely on your choices. Several options lie before you. You could go to 'The Red Anchor Inn' recommended by Marcos to find work and lodging, or you could go to 'Merchant's Square' to gather information about this city. You could also explore more around the harbor or start an adventure in a completely different direction. If you're ready to explore the secrets and dangers hidden behind this city's splendid exterior, please decide your next action. A fate as deep and unpredictable as the sea of Navarro del Mar awaits you.

--- --- # 📜 Valtherion - Exploration Session ##

Iron Will, Imperial Glory

You enter Valtherion territory riding in an Imperial Legion carriage. Every city and fortress is designed with military precision, and soldiers wearing red cloaks patrol the streets with disciplined steps. As the red Legion flags flutter in the wind, you arrive in a city filled with the mixed sounds of soldiers training and blacksmiths' hammers. War preparations never cease, and Magnus Valtherion's shadow looms over everything. In this land governed by iron discipline and military order, what will your choice be?
--- --- A red shadow stretched long across the road. As your carriage passed through the eastern gate of Valtherion territory, the sunset turned the Legion flags blood-red. The wooden wheels of the carriage rolled with a rhythmic sound over the meticulously paved stone road. The walls of Legionaria, the epitome of military architecture, pierced the sky with overwhelming height, and the shadows of ever-vigilant sentries could be seen in the watchtowers. Valtherion was the Empire's last bastion. Its power came from the Legion, and the Legion's power began with discipline. As the carriage passed through the gate, soldiers approached from the checkpoint. Their armor gleamed bronze, and their red cloaks proudly displayed the symbol of House Valtherion. "Traveler. State your purpose and duration of stay." The soldier's voice was as firm as a command. The coachman submitted the necessary documents on your behalf, and the soldier thoroughly verified them before granting passage. His gaze lingered on you momentarily but passed without particular suspicion. Upon entering the city, Valtherion's true appearance unfolded. Every building was designed with defensive elements integrated, and the streets were precisely divided like a chessboard. In the main square, Legion recruits could be seen training. With the instructor's shouts, hundreds of soldiers wielded their weapons in perfect motion, and the sound was synchronized like a single heartbeat. "That training happens four times a day," explained the coachman. "For the glory of the Empire, Valtherion's soldiers never rest." People with hollow eyes moved about the streets. Stern determination was more often seen on their faces than smiles. Even children were more often seen imitating soldiers with small wooden swords rather than playing games. "Have you decided where to stay?" asked the coachman. "I can recommend a good place. 'Red Eagle Inn' is frequently visited by retired soldiers. It's a place overflowing with rumors and information. Or there's the 'Iron Memory Inn' if you prefer somewhere quieter." The carriage headed toward the city center. There, the Valtherion family castle overlooked everything. Despite being designed for military purposes, the walls and towers boasted majestic beauty. But it was the aesthetics of swords and shields, not flowers and butterflies. Turning a corner of the city, a large mural caught your eye. It depicted Legion soldiers bravely fighting with red cloaks flying. Below the mural was inscribed the House Valtherion motto: "Die with sword in hand, never on bended knee." On one side of the street, blacksmiths were ceaselessly crafting swords and armor. The sound of their hammers was like the city's pulse. With each hammer strike, red sparks flew, looking almost like omens of war. The coachman stopped the carriage and said, "We've arrived at the Red Eagle Inn." Stepping down in front of the inn, you faced a solid stone building with a red eagle sign. Even this building looked like a small fortress. In front of the door sat an old soldier, seemingly retired, his face marked with traces of countless battles. "A new face," he said, looking at you. "Welcome to Valtherion. But I warn you, this is no place for the weak." His voice carried a weight born from experience. The coachman unloaded your luggage and bid farewell. "Traveler, I wish you luck. May your stay in Valtherion be meaningful." Then he added in a slightly lower voice, "And be careful. Even the walls have ears in this place." From afar, the sound of Legion trumpets echoed. People on the street unanimously turned their heads toward Valtherion Castle. Special soldiers wearing black armor and red cloaks were marching there. They were the Praetoriani, the elite guards of House Valtherion. The old soldier in front of the inn murmured, "Iron Oath... Lord Magnus's shadows." His voice mixed respect and fear. You now stand in the heart of Valtherion. In this place where military discipline and imperial ambition permeate the air, what will your choice be? Several options lie before you. You could enter the Red Eagle Inn to gather information from retired soldiers, explore the city further to directly experience Valtherion's culture and atmosphere, visit the forge to learn about weapons and equipment, or observe the Legion training grounds more carefully. As the sun sets and Legion soldiers begin their patrols, both the power and danger of Valtherion await you.

--- --- # 📜 Corvinio - Quest Session I ##

Inhabitants of the Forest, a Cycle of Burning Hatred and Fury

When you came to your senses, you were alone in a gloomy forest, ankle-deep in damp, decaying leaves. How you got here, your previous memories are hazy, like mist. The massive trees around you were grotesquely twisted, obscuring the sky, and the faint moonlight seeping through was the only source of light. You have been unceremoniously thrown into the deep forests of the Corvinio territory, a land rumored to breathe with secrets and conspiracies. In the desperate silence, the distant sounds of human screams and beastly roars mingled, and an instinctive pull, along with an unidentifiable anxiety, compelled you to move towards the source of the sounds. There, you will confront the brutal underside of civilization.
--- --- When you came to, you felt the cold touch of earth against your cheek. What was your last memory? Was it a violent flash of light before everything went dark, or were you swept away by a massive wave? Nothing was clear anymore. Slowly opening your eyes, your vision was filled with a dark forest densely packed with grotesquely twisted, colossal trees. Their branches stretched towards the sky like greedy claws, and the moonlight that barely seeped through them only added to the gloom. The air was damp and heavy, a mixture of the smell of earth, rotting leaves, and an unidentifiable, faintly metallic scent pricking your nose. You had no idea where this place was, or why you were abandoned alone in such a deep forest. What was clear was that this was not the world you knew. You instinctively pushed yourself up and surveyed your surroundings. The thick layer of fallen leaves muffled your footsteps, and even the sound of the wind was faint; an oppressive silence hung in the air, as if time itself had stopped. Through the gaps in the leaves, glimpses of the night sky revealed unfamiliar constellations. Of the three moons, one, Mortis, cast a particularly ominous red glow. Corvinio territory. Located in the southern part of the continent, famous for its secrets, conspiracies, and an intelligence guild known as the 'Larks.' The forests here were especially notorious for being easy to get lost in, and for harboring dangerous beasts and entities that shunned human contact. Fortunately, your body seemed to be without any serious injuries, though only a rusty dagger hung loosely at your waist. This was your only weapon. It was then. Breaking the silence, sharp screams and the deafening roars of beasts echoed from not too far away. Your heart began to pound violently. It was a human voice. A desperate, urgent cry. And as if in response, the menacing howls of what sounded like multiple beasts shook the forest. It was not curiosity, but survival instinct that moved you. Towards the source of the sounds, you began to move, keeping as low and stealthy as possible. Twigs snagged your clothes, and rough underbrush scratched your skin, but none of that mattered. How far had you gone? Reaching the edge of the forest, an unbelievable sight unfolded before your eyes. It was a small pioneer village. A dozen or so log cabins were clustered together, but now, the place was a scene of utter chaos. Flames licked at every house, and black smoke billowed, staining the night sky. And in the village square and alleys, beings with human-like forms but possessing the heads and features of beasts – Beastmen – were rampaging. Some had the horns and legs of goats, others the head and sharp claws of wolves, and some even possessed massive, bear-like bodies. They wielded crude weapons and attacked humans indiscriminately. "Kuaaaargh! Humans! Get off our land!" A goat-headed Beastman roared, swinging an axe. At his feet lay an old man, apparently already dead. Screams, cries, the clash of weapons, and the savage war cries of the Beastmen mingled, creating a vision of hell. A few village men were resisting with farming tools or hunting bows, but they were no match in numbers or strength. Women and children, terrified, screamed and tried to flee, but the cordon was tightening. You could only watch this horrifying massacre from your hiding place. A sense of helplessness and rage welled up simultaneously, but with the rusty dagger in your hand, there was nothing you could do. Just as the massacre was nearing its end, a horn blast suddenly echoed from the other side of the forest. With a thunderous clatter of hooves, a dozen armed horsemen appeared. They wore breastplates emblazoned with the black raven sigil of House Corvinio and were armed with sharp spears and swords. It was the Corvinio Guard. "Damn, late again! Those cursed horned bastards!" Shouted the middle-aged captain at the lead, his face scarred. His voice carried anger, but also a deep resignation. At the Guard's appearance, the Beastmen hesitated for a moment, looking flustered, but then quickly abandoned the remaining humans and began to scatter into the forest. A few guardsmen tried to pursue them, but the captain waved them off. "Enough. They'll scurry away like rats anyway. Check for survivors first!" The guardsmen dismounted and began to search the burning village. You remained hidden, watching their actions. The slaughter was over, but the air was still thick with the stench of blood and ash. The captain surveyed the gruesome scene and let out a deep sigh. His face was etched with the anguish of the region's unstable security and the unending conflict with the Beastmen. Soon after, a guardsman pointed in your direction and shouted. "Captain! Someone's over there!" Your hiding spot discovered, you had no choice but to reveal yourself. The sharp gazes of the guardsmen fell upon you at once. The captain's eyes, in particular, were filled with suspicion and wariness. He looked you up and down, then asked in a low voice. "...Who are you? What were you doing here at this time, in this place? You look like an outsider..." His hand moved towards the hilt of his sword. The situation was turning against you. In this dark and cruel land of Corvinio, your first crisis and moment of choice had arrived. The harsh reality of an unfamiliar world unfolds before you. You've just witnessed a horrific massacre and are now under the suspicion of the Corvinio Guard. You could try to explain your situation to the captain and seek cooperation, or perhaps look for another way to escape this dangerous predicament. Maybe you could search the devastated village for clues or supplies necessary for survival. The gloomy forests of Corvinio still envelop you, and your future destiny will be determined by your choices. In this chaos, which path will you take?

--- --- # 📜 Corvinio - Exploration Session ##

Land of Secrets and Shadows

You arrive at 'Black Seagull Harbor', a small port city in the mist-shrouded territory of Corvinio. In this city where labyrinthine narrow alleys blend with magnificent buildings, information and secrets are always traded. With the feeling that someone's eyes are watching you, you step into this city during the festival period known as the 'Masquerade Celebration'. Your story begins in this dark city where truth hidden in shadows, noble conspiracies, and underground world transactions take place. In this place where no one reveals their true face, you must find your own path.
--- --- Gray mist wrapped around your ankles and covered the entire harbor. As the distant sound of bells announced the beginning of twilight, the street lamps around the harbor began to light up one by one. You disembarked from the ship that just arrived and breathed in the air of the unfamiliar land of Corvinio for the first time. Black Seagull Harbor was the gateway to Corvinio territory and a gathering place for information. The time of your arrival coincidentally fell during Corvinio's annual festival called the 'Masquerade Celebration'. Throughout the city, people were coming and going wearing elaborate masks—a special time when anyone could wander the city hiding their true identity. "You must be new here, stranger." You turned around at the sudden voice. A woman in a red dress wearing a black feathered mask that covered only half her face was looking at you. "Everyone who sets foot in Corvinio for the first time has that expression. A mixture of caution and curiosity..." she said. "In this city, everything hides behind masks. Truth, lies, danger, opportunity." She handed you a small piece of paper. On it was a small map stamped with a red wax seal. "Find the 'Black Raven Tavern'. If you need information, you can get it there. But be careful... nothing is free in Corvinio." With those words, she disappeared into the mist. The map in your hand showed the path leading from the harbor to the city center. As you left the harbor, the true appearance of the city was revealed. Narrow, winding alleys were intertwined like spider webs, and stone buildings rose high toward the sky. The light from street lamps collided with the fog, wrapping the surroundings in a mysterious atmosphere. People wearing various masks were coming and going on every street. From masks decorated with colorful feathers to simple cloth masks, they all looked different, but they all had in common that they were hiding their identities. You were the only person not wearing a mask, which made you feel even more like an outsider. While passing through an alley, you arrived at a small square near an old clock tower. There, people had gathered to listen to someone's story. "...and when the third moon turns red, beings from the Shadow Lands are said to have invaded our territory. Corvinio's 'Larks' have already tracked their movements, but they say they still don't know what they're planning." The storyteller wearing a black cloak and red mask said this. People were listening to his story with a mixture of fear and curiosity in their eyes. "Of course, whether these rumors are true or not doesn't matter. In Corvinio, what's more valuable than truth is how much money that truth can bring you." The sound of people's laughter echoed across the square. When the storyteller's performance ended, you headed toward the 'Black Raven Tavern' marked on the map. After passing through a few more alleys, an old stone building appeared. On the red sign was engraved the raven symbol along with the words 'Black Raven'. When you opened the tavern door, warm air welcomed you along with the murmur of people, the sound of clinking glasses, and the sound of string instruments coming from afar. The interior was decorated with red velvet curtains and dark wood, and various paintings and maps hung on the walls. People wearing masks sat at each table, and some of them glanced at you occasionally. "This is my first time seeing your face, guest." A woman in a black dress wearing a silver mask that covered half her face approached you. She appeared to be the owner of the tavern. "You don't have a mask. That could be dangerous during the festival period. In this city, everyone has secrets, and masks are the shields that protect those secrets." She guided you to a table and said. "How can I help you? Did you come simply to drink, or are you looking for something else?" Her words seemed to carry more meaning than simple hospitality. It seemed to remind you that in Corvinio, information and secrets are the most valuable commodities. Various choices lie before you. You could ask the tavern owner for information, or have conversations with other guests. Or you could explore the city more during the festival period, or return to the harbor to find other opportunities. Mist-shrouded Corvinio is waiting for your choice.

--- --- # 📜 Firnaden - Exploration Session ##

Kingdom of Forest and Secrets

You wake up to morning after spending the night at the 'Traveler's Rest' located at the edge of Firnaden's ancient forest. Light streaming through the window creates golden stripes across the room. This elven territory is filled with ancient trees and mysterious energy, but darkness lurks within its beauty. In the village, rumors circulate about missing people and strange cries heard from the forest. You might be able to gather various information at the 'Golden Leaf Tavern,' and perhaps learn the secrets of this land at the nearby 'Ancient Tree' temple. Both the mysteries and dangers of Firnaden await you.
--- --- You open your eyes to the morning light that seeps into the room like a gentle breath. Sunlight entering through the window creates golden stripes across the room, and outside, dancing leaves sway as if whispering. This is the 'Traveler's Rest,' a small inn located at the edge of Firnaden territory. Last night, you arrived here after a long journey and decided to stay for the night. The room is decorated with elements of nature. The walls seem to be made of living wood, with ancient verse delicately engraved in elvish characters. All the furniture has been carefully hand-carved, and blue crystals embedded in the ceiling glow softly like stars. As you step outside, the morning scenery of Firnaden greets you. The area around the inn maintains a miraculously perfect harmony. Ancient giant trees pierce the sky, and between them, elvish buildings stand as one with nature. Some structures are built on living trees, and the bridges connecting them are made of branches and leaves, appearing as part of the forest. The innkeeper, Eldrin, smiles at you. He is an elf who appears to have lived for hundreds of years, with silver hair and emerald eyes. "Did you sleep well, traveler?" His voice sounds like a gentle breeze. "Breakfast is ready. It comes with sweet sky honey and 'Starlight Fruit' tea. Welcome to Firnaden... although shadows now loom over our land." A hint of concern can be felt in his words. As you sit at the table, you hear conversations around you. Two elves are speaking in low voices. "I heard another person went missing. This time it was Rumilia, who was gathering herbs in the 'Moonlight Forest.'" "That's the third one... They say strange cries were heard from the forest too. Firnaden has never been like this before." One of the elves notices your gaze, stops talking, and looks at you. Her eyes contain the wisdom of many years. "A human traveler. Be careful. Our forest is not as safe as it used to be," she says. "Some evil influence is flowing in from the Shadow Lands. Grand Duchess Auriella has already ordered reinforced vigilance, but... something seems to have already set foot in our land." The other elf adds, "If you need information, go to the 'Golden Leaf Tavern' in the center of the village. It's where various travelers and hunters gather, so it might help." Stepping outside and looking around, you can more clearly feel Firnaden's exotic beauty. In the center of the village is a clear lake called the 'Silver Wave,' with buildings naturally arranged around it. Across the lake stands a majestic tree, known as the 'Ancient Tree' temple. You can see elven priests worshipping there. "Is this your first visit?" You turn around at the sudden voice. A young female elf is standing there. Her eyes are as clear and blue as a lake. "My name is Ilia. Feel free to ask if you're curious about this place. Although there are many dangers these days, Firnaden is still a land of beauty and wisdom." Several paths stretch out before you. You could go to the Golden Leaf Tavern to gather information, visit the Ancient Tree temple to learn the secrets of this land, or explore the mysterious forest around the village. As the sun rises, bathing the entire forest in golden light, both the mysteries and dangers of Firnaden await you.

--- --- # 📜 Drakonova - Quest Session I ##

Land of Bone and Frost

You barely clung to your fading consciousness amidst the tearing cold. As you opened your eyes, all you could see was an endlessly sprawling, harsh snowy plain. Under the dark blue night sky, three moons alone cast a pale light, illuminating this desperate landscape. The ridges of the snow-covered mountains, rising like the spine of a giant dragon, cast ominous shadows, and the biting wind, sharp as a knife, relentlessly lashed at your exposed skin. As all sensation in your body froze and even pain grew faint, you couldn't even recall where you were or why you were in such an extreme situation. The only thing you remembered was the distorted rift in space, and the overwhelming energy of chaos felt beyond it.
--- --- Looking around, there was no sign of human presence, not even a trace of life, only a desolate snowy plain to greet you. The snow beneath your feet reached your knees, and with every step, your whole body made a despairing sound. How long had you wandered? From the other side of your fading consciousness, faint lights began to flicker. Like a lighthouse discovered in the middle of a vast ocean, it cast a single ray of hope into your despair. You squeezed out your last remaining strength and staggered towards those lights. As you got closer, you realized they weren't just lights, but moving shadows accompanied by rough voices. Men clad in giant wolf pelts discovered you almost simultaneously. They had a rough and unrefined appearance, much like the severe cold of the North, but their eyes shone with a toughness forged for survival. Thick leather and reinforced iron armor, along with the crude battle axes at their waists, indicated they were no ordinary hunters. They were the 'Warriors of the Northern.' "What in the damnation is that?" The giant of a man at the forefront, wearing the pelt of a red wolf's head, exclaimed in a rough voice upon spotting you. His voice was as cold and sharp as cracking ice. The other warriors also fixed their gazes on you, their hands naturally moving towards the weapons at their waists. Their eyes held a mixture of wariness and slight curiosity. "Is it alive? In this crazy blizzard?" Another warrior said, brushing off an icicle clinging to his mustache. His eyes were full of suspicion and caution. Your appearance was too foreign to this harsh northern land. The warrior wearing the red wolf pelt slowly approached you. A heavy steel axe was already in his hand, and he scrutinized your every move with a sharp gaze, as if unwilling to miss a single detail. Behind him, the other warriors began to encircle you in a semicircle. Their movements were as coordinated as a well-trained wolf pack. "Are you coming to, stranger? Who are you, and what were you doing in this godforsaken snowy plain?" His question carried a threatening tone, but at the same time, a hint of curiosity could be felt. They seemed to be trying to gauge whether you were a hostile entity or just an unfortunate, lost soul. Only frozen breath escaped your lips; forming a proper answer was difficult. The warrior observed your condition for a moment, then let out a rough sigh and nodded towards his comrades. "We'll take him for now. Can't just leave him to freeze to death. But we'll need to keep a close watch. Too many strange bastards have been showing up from the north lately." At his words, the other warriors nodded silently. They supported your heavy body and helped you to your feet. Their touch was rough, but no unnecessary hostility was felt. They began to drag you in the direction they had come from. The blizzard still raged fiercely, and your consciousness began to fade again. How much time had passed? With the smell of burning wood and a faint warmth, you opened your eyes again. You were lying on a bed covered with thick animal hides in a small, cramped room made of rough wood. A Hwato (fire pit) in the corner of the room burned weakly, providing warmth, and hunting tools and old weapons hung on the walls. Faint dawn light seeped through a crack too small to be called a window. The door creaked open, and the warrior who had worn the red wolf pelt entered. He had now removed the head-pelt, revealing a middle-aged man with skin weathered by the northern gales and the sharp eyes of a hawk. Seeing you awake, he raised an eyebrow slightly, as if surprised. His name was 'Cold Wind' Grom, the leader of the squad guarding this small outpost. "Are you feeling a bit better, stranger? You've got some serious grit, surviving a blizzard like that. And your wound… that wasn't an ordinary wound, how did it heal so quickly?" Grom looked over your shoulder at the peculiar scar, now almost healed, with a puzzled expression. "Magic? Or did you receive some god's blessing?" He pulled a wooden chair and sat beside your bed, continuing to speak. His voice was still rough, but there was a more searching tone than hostility. "This is the northernmost tip of the Drakonova territory, the 'Frostwolf Claw' outpost. I am Grom. Who are you? Where did you come from, and why were you collapsed in that hellish snowy plain? I couldn't even sleep properly, wondering about your identity." Grom stared at you intently, waiting for your answer. His gaze was sharp, as if trying to see through everything about you. The characteristic caution and pragmatic sense of a northerner living in this harsh land emanated from his entire being. He seemed to have vaguely sensed the secrets and fragments of power you possessed. "Recently, strange signs have been detected beyond the northern border, in the 'Land of Eternal Winter.' There are also ominous rumors that ancient nightmares slumbering beneath the ice are about to awaken… Are you perhaps connected to that?" Grom's voice dropped low. His face showed deep concern, along with a cold determination. "If you are not our enemy, we might need your strength. This North… it seems it will soon face a great trial." You have just awakened in an unknown world, at a remote outpost in the northern Drakonova territory of the Aquilonian continent. Grom, the northern warrior who rescued you, is curious about your identity and how you came to be here, while also mentioning the ominous shadow looming over the North. Several choices lie before you. You could tell Grom about what you experienced to gain more information, or you could remain silent to further assess his intentions and the surrounding situation. Alternatively, if the opportunity arises, you could leave this outpost and explore this world independently to find clues about your predicament. As the sun begins to rise on this cold dawn, the harsh reality of Drakonova and the threat from the North await your next move.

--- --- # 📜 Drakonova - Exploration Session ##

Land of Blood and Steel

You regain consciousness in the midst of flesh-searing cold. Standing alone on an endless white snowfield, in silence as if time has stopped. As the massive mountain range, rising like a dragon's spine, looks down upon you, the wind, like death's touch, claws at your face. The moment you discover a small village with a glimmer of hopeful light, your fate rests in the hands of a massive northern hunter who suddenly appears. By his rough mercy, you are guided to an inn called 'Northern Wind's Shelter' and your life is spared. The hunter leaves you with a final warning - "Drakonova's winter not only forges warriors but also kills them." This second chance given to you, a stranger, is just the beginning of a new adventure in this harsh land.
--- --- You open your eyes, startled by the sudden cold biting into your flesh. The coldness was beyond mere sensation - it was pain that penetrated to the bone. With each breath, your lungs felt like they were freezing, making your body instinctively curl up. The endless white snowfield was quiet as if time had stopped. The sun was still hidden beyond the horizon, but the sky of this northern land was pushing back the darkness with its unique blue tint. Over the endless snowfield, a massive mountain range rose like a dragon's spine, piercing the sky. Those mountains stood majestic like ancient sentinels who had protected this land for ages. The wind lashed at your cheeks with a sharpness that cut through flesh, and its cold touch was like death's whisper. The snowstorm obscured your vision, dancing sometimes gently, sometimes violently. That white dance was beautiful, yet at the same time, a deadly threat. You rose to your feet on trembling legs. The snow beneath your feet reached your ankles, and each step filled your ears with a 'crunch' sound. Looking around, you saw a small village not too far away. From there, faint lamplight stubbornly shone through the snowstorm. The houses in the northern style had pointed roofs to withstand the weight of snow, and walls built with thick logs protected people from this murderous cold. Smoke rising from chimneys swayed in the wind, signaling evidence of life. **Crunch** Suddenly, you heard heavy footsteps in the snow behind you. "What are you doing out here in this dog of a weather? Looks like you want to freeze to death." A hunter of enormous build was looking down at you. He was a giant-like man who appeared to be over 2 meters tall. A thick coat made of northern wolf fur made his shoulders look even broader, and half of his face was covered with bushy red beard. His nose and cheekbones were reddened by long exposure to frost and wind, and the deep wrinkles were evidence of the harsh northern life. On his back hung a bow and quiver, and at his waist was a hunting dagger. In his hand were two mountain hares that seemed freshly hunted. His breath rose as white smoke in the cold air. "Can't speak? Must be your tongue's frozen." He said with a thick northern accent. "Stay here and wolves will be feasting on your corpse before the next snowstorm comes. Follow me if you want to live." Without further explanation, he turned and began walking toward the village. His movements exuded confidence even in this extreme cold and snow - the kind of confidence only someone trained in such an environment since birth could possess. You had no choice but to follow him. The path to the village wasn't long, but each step was a challenge because of the cold and deep snow. The hunter occasionally looked back to make sure you were following. Upon reaching the village, it was more lively than you'd expected. Residents starting their morning routines, a smoking forge, people preparing hunted game. These people lived accepting this extreme cold as an ordinary part of daily life. The hunter led you to a large log building in the center of the village. Above the door hung a sign that read 'Northern Wind's Shelter'. "This is our village inn. Go inside, warm yourself up, and get something to eat. Not even letting a dog freeze to death is the northern way." He handed you one of the hares he was carrying. "Use this to get a meal. Once your body warms up and your tongue thaws, then we'll talk." The hunter nodded and opened the inn door. As the door opened, warm air rushed out along with the smell of roasted meat, bustling conversation, and the distant melody of a northern harp. "Remember, Drakonova's winter not only forges warriors but also kills them. You were lucky, stranger."

--- --- # 📜 Mysticshield - Quest Session I ##

The Ancient Guardian, Golden-Winged Hunter

As if cast out from a twisted rift between dimensions, you awaken with amnesia, alone in the desolate highlands of the Mysticshield territory. Amidst the bone-chilling wind and strangely contorted trees, you discover Naquelyra, an injured woman who seems to have barely escaped the nightmare of the Shadow Lands. Desperation and ancient sorrow reside in her golden eyes, and her wounds are not mere injuries, but evidence of a darkness consuming the world. At a moment of dire crisis, a patrol of the Knights of Aetherium appears, and your fate, along with hers, takes a new turn towards the heart of Mysticshield.
--- --- When you regained consciousness, what weighed down your body was the chill of the hard earth and a wind that seemed to cut through your flesh. Opening your eyes, your blurred vision took in a sky of low-hanging gray clouds, and beneath it, an endlessly sprawling, desolate highland landscape. The damp, ankle-deep grass was a lifeless, dark green, and the sparsely standing trees were all grotesquely twisted, their gaunt branches reaching towards the sky. You could only vaguely surmise that this was the territory of Mysticshield; you had no memory of who you were or why you had come here. Like a shipwrecked boat tossed in a stormy sea, you had been thrown into this unfamiliar world, utterly unprepared. Looking around, there was no sign of human life. The intermittent, cold rain stole what little warmth your body held, and the sound of the wind echoed in your ears like the eerie lament of the dead. This place, Mysticshield, was known as the home of the Guardians of Light, the Knights of Aetherium, yet the scene before you resembled less a land of honor and magic and more a forsaken place dominated by despair and solitude. The Aetherium crystals, said to well with ancient magic, seemed to have lost their luster here, barely maintaining their existence with a dull, murky blue. Then, a faint groan reached you from a crevice in the rocks. Approaching cautiously, you found a woman in a wretched state. Lying on the ground, she seemed to be barely clinging to life. Beneath her torn black cloak, her exposed skin was covered in dark reddish scabs and strange black spots that were spreading. Like a living poison, these spots seemed to be devouring her life force. Her hair, a radiant gold that seemed to hold the sunlight, was now matted with dirt and blood, having lost its original luster. Two small, seemingly broken horns protruded from near her temples, one of which had a black crack near its base. The woman, her brow furrowed in pain, was taking shallow breaths. Beside her lay a longsword with intricate engravings, now chipped and clearly marked with blackened scorches, carelessly discarded. She looked like a defeated soldier who had barely escaped to this place after a desperate battle. As you approached, she looked up at you with wary eyes. Her eyes, unlike those of ordinary humans, were pure gold with vertically slit pupils, though now they shone dimly with pain and exhaustion. “…Who… are you?” A hoarse voice struggled from her chapped lips. Her voice held a deep resonance, hard to believe it was human, and was imbued with an ineffable sadness. “Is this… the border of… Mysticshield…?” She muttered, looking around. You nodded silently in response. The woman fell silent for a moment, as if contemplating something, then closed her eyes again with a pained expression. A dark energy emanating from her body exuded a curse so potent it seemed to wither the grass around her. It was clear that these wounds were not mere physical injuries, but had been inflicted by a far more sinister and fundamental power. “I am… Naquelyra… I was trying to stop… those who crossed over… from the Shadow Lands…” She spoke with difficulty, catching her breath intermittently. The words ‘Shadow Lands’ struck your mind with a chilling impact. The cursed land born in the heart of the Empire after the Great Cataclysm, filled with demons, undead, and distorted reality. The fact that its corruption was reaching this far sent a shiver down your spine. Naquelyra’s wounds seemed to be proof of it. “Their… leader… is trying to open… a new rift… They intend to use… Mysticshield’s Aetherium essence…” A desperate light flickered in her golden eyes. Wiping the black blood trickling from her broken horn with a trembling hand, she continued, “It must be… stopped… But… with my current strength…” Naquelyra’s body began to tremble faintly. You could feel the flame of her life dwindling. You hesitated. With no memory of your own, you had no obligation to help this enigmatic woman, a being entangled in dangerous affairs related to the Shadow Lands. Yet, the desperation and ancient wisdom in her eyes, and her pure will to protect this world, held you rooted to the spot. Perhaps helping her would be the first meaningful act you performed in this desolate world. Naquelyra’s condition was rapidly deteriorating. Her golden eyes were losing their light, and her breathing grew more labored. Darkness had already deeply engulfed the mountainside, and the intermittent rain had turned into a downpour so heavy it was difficult to see ahead. You carefully helped her up, but the rain-soaked ground was slippery, and your own strength was reaching its limit. The dark energy emanating from her body felt chilling as it seemed to seep through your fingertips and into your entire being. At this rate, it was clear that both of you would meet a miserable end in these desolate highlands. Just then, from the darkness, came the faint sound of hooves accompanied by the clanging of steel. Tensing, you looked towards the sound, and three figures on horseback appeared along the rugged mountain path. They wore cloaks of blue and silver, and their armor, glistening wet from the rain, was studded with blue gems presumed to be Aetherium crystals, emitting a faint glow. The knight at the lead, his sharp gaze glinting from beneath his helm, watched you and Naquelyra intently. Their horses, like well-trained warhorses, remained unperturbed by the harsh weather, and the saddles bore the clearly engraved emblem of House Mysticshield: a blue shield crossed by a silver sword. It was a patrol of the Knights of Aetherium. “Halt! Who goes there!” the lead knight shouted in a low, authoritative voice. His voice cut through the sound of the downpour, reaching your ears clearly. The knights swiftly maneuvered their horses to surround you and Naquelyra, their hands moving to the hilts of their swords. A sense of vigilance and sternness emanated from them. “This one… seems to have been corrupted by the Shadow Lands,” another knight remarked, observing Naquelyra’s condition. His eyes held grave concern, and perhaps even a hint of disgust. Naquelyra’s broken horns and black spots clearly signaled to them that this was no ordinary situation. “Her condition is critical. She must be transported to Luna Fortress immediately. She needs the healers’ aid,” the lead knight decided. His gaze turned to you. “Who are you? What is your relationship with this individual? Why are you in such a dangerous place?” His questions were sharp, his suspicion of your identity palpable. However, saving Naquelyra seemed to be the immediate priority. “…For now, you will accompany us to the fortress. Your interrogation will be conducted there.” The lead knight’s words were tantamount to an order. Resistance seemed futile. One of the knights dismounted and carefully, yet firmly, placed Naquelyra onto his horse. Another knight gestured for you to ride behind him on his horse. In that moment, the iron-like discipline of the Knights of Aetherium and the harsh reality of their position on the front lines defending against the Shadow Lands bore down on you. Amidst the cold rain, your fate, and Naquelyra’s, was now heading towards the heart of Mysticshield. You are to accompany the Knights of Aetherium to Luna Fortress at their 'invitation.' This unexpected encounter could be a new threat or an opportunity for you. At the fortress, you might learn more about Naquelyra’s identity and the threat she spoke of, while also potentially facing a rigorous interrogation by the knights. Perhaps you might even find a clue to your lost memories. In the darkness, filled only with the sound of rain and hooves, you must surrender yourself to the unknown fate that lies ahead.

--- --- # 📜 Mysticshield - Exploration Session ##

Land of Magic and Chivalry

Awakening with no memories in the endless Aetherium lands of the Highland Mysticshield, you find yourself thrown into the world with no knowledge of your identity. Amidst the crystal-clear sky and vibrant meadows, you encounter Elinore, an herb collector, who guides you to learn about the 'Aetherium Garden Village' and the 'Blue Crystal' inn at the foot of the mountain. Now you take the first step on a journey to discover who you are, beginning a fateful adventure that will unfold in the Mysticshield territory.
--- --- The highland plateau of the Guardian Mountains that rise endlessly toward the sky. Upon opening your eyes, a crystal-clear sky stretched out above you. A perfect natural panorama, as if drawn by the hand of God, filled your vision. The majestic ridge of the enormous mountain stood solemn as if it had been there since the beginning of time, rising proudly toward the sky like the back of an ancient dragon. The cobalt blue sky, without a single cloud, seemed to captivate even your soul with its overwhelming presence. Below your feet, a highland meadow filled with the mysterious energy of Aetherium stretched endlessly. The early morning sunlight shone obliquely, breathing life's light into each blade of grass, and their subtle shimmer looked like countless stars scattered on the ground. Whenever the cold wind carrying the mountain's essence blew, the grasses all bowed together like ripples and then rose again. It was a moment where the breath of living nature could be felt directly. Turning your gaze beyond the vast meadow, you could see a small village far below. The houses with blue roofs that seemed to have jumped out of a fairy tale, the small square, and the people moving between them looked like a procession of ants from such a staggering height. Surrounding the village were Aetherium gardens with a blue glow, and even from a distance, their mysterious energy could be faintly felt. "Oh my! Who's there?" Turning around at the surprised voice from behind, you saw a woman with deep traces of time etched on her face. Her silver hair was neatly tied back, and her eyes, tempered by the elements, contained living wisdom. The worn leather pouch hanging at her waist was filled with various herbs and flowers that seemed freshly gathered. In her right hand, she held a blue flower that looked like a piece of the sky had been plucked. A particularly strong Aetherium energy pulsated from that flower. "To appear suddenly in such a remote place... Are you perhaps lost?" The woman asked cautiously. Her voice carried kindness along with natural vigilance. She slowly lowered her hand permeated with the scent of herbs and took a few steps closer. A shadow of caution passed over her face for a moment as she saw you. But when no answer came from you, a few more wrinkles appeared on the old woman's forehead. "...Are you alright? Do you need help..." Her voice trembled slightly, but she took courage and stepped one step closer. You could see the tension gradually easing in her eyes as she observed you carefully. "You don't seem like someone who would cause harm. If you meant harm, you would have done something already." The woman continued, carefully placing the glowing blue flower in her pouch as if it were a precious treasure. "Can you see the village down there? It's called the Aetherium Garden Village. It's a small village on the northern border of the Mysticshield territory. If you need anything, I think it would be good to visit there. There's an inn called the 'Blue Crystal', and Martha, the innkeeper, is a kind-hearted person. Oh, my name is Elinore... If you happen to meet Martha, please mention my name. It might help a little." The woman smiled, pointing to the village. She bowed politely with deep respect and returned to her work. But she still occasionally glanced at you while collecting herbs. Her movements carried the grace and familiarity that only someone who had lived in these mountains for decades could possess. Looking around, you couldn't remember anything. You didn't know why you were here, where you came from, or even who you were. Were you a warrior? Or perhaps some kind of adventurer? Those memories were as faint as if hidden behind thick fog, seeming within reach yet never quite graspable. You looked at the village below once more. You might be able to find clues about your existence there. Although your memory was gone, your instincts were alive. Following the mountain path, it seemed you could arrive without much difficulty. Taking a deep breath of the fresh mountain air, you slowly began to descend along the mountain path. The sound of green grass crunching beneath your feet, the chirping of birds in the distance, and the quiet resonance of the mountain accompanied your journey. You couldn't know what awaited you on the path to the village and beyond, but what was clear was that this was the beginning of your new journey. And the feeling that something had led you here felt like the hand of fate rather than mere coincidence.

--- --- # 📜 Badelburg - Quest Session I ##

The Lost Relic

This journey may seem like a simple mission to find Augustus's relic, but as you take steps toward the chalice, the boundary between faith and doubt will blur. In the process of recovering the relic from the clutches of orcs, you may face the truth hidden beneath the religious fervor of Badelburg. Like the flames rising from the stake in Midenheim, whether this journey becomes a light illuminating your inner self or a fire that burns everything down... depends solely on your choice.
--- --- Your eyelids felt heavy. Each time consciousness slowly returned, your head throbbed. It felt like emerging from a formless dream. You blinked several times and looked around. This was an unfamiliar place. The last thing you remembered was... no, your memories were hazy. You slowly rose to your feet. Your entire body ached. The ground was damp, and a cold autumn rain fell intermittently. Around you stretched hills and fields mixed with brown and golden hues. The sky was covered with gray clouds, and a crow flew overhead. In the distance, beyond the hills, you could see the outline of Midenheim. The heart of Badelburg territory, the City of Faith. The massive cathedral's spires pierced the sky, and the bell towers of churches large and small surrounded it. The entire city resembled a gigantic fortress of faith. "Faith is immortal, and we are its instruments." These words were engraved on the roadside leading to Midenheim. You slowly stood up and walked in that direction. As the city grew closer, the sound of bells became more distinct, and the smell of incense and burning flesh stung your nostrils. As you approached the entrance to the city, three paths appeared. To the left, monks dressed in black walked in a line, and to the right, believers in white clothes passed by carrying flowers and candles. And in the center... your gaze stopped. On the hill, in the eastern square of the city, columns of fire were rising. It was a stake. Sharp screams could be heard from within the flames. People gathered around it, and knights in golden armor stood guard. Amid the majestic hymns echoing through the air, the screams of burning souls mixed to create a strange dissonance. Just then, the sound of hooves came from the dirt road. Three knights wearing black cloaks and armor with golden decorations rode toward you. On their chests was engraved the golden sun, the symbol of Augustus. "Traveler, halt there!" The knight at the front raised his hand to stop you. "What brings you to Midenheim?" Before you could answer, the knight behind him stepped forward. His face was contorted with tension. "A catastrophe has occurred! The relic of Augustus being transported from the south to the cathedral was attacked by a horde of orcs!" The third knight continued, "It was the relic containing the Golden Chalice. Lady Saint Adelheim is immersed in anger and sorrow. She has promised a great reward to whoever retrieves the relic, and the Saint herself will personally bestow blessings and compensation." Before they finished speaking, the road suddenly became busy. Knights of the Augustus Order, heavily armed and mounted, poured out of the city. Among them were inquisitors dressed in black robes. Their faces were cold and determined, and metal boxes hung at their waists. Torture tools. "Hurry! Before the chalice is defiled by pagan hands!" one of the inquisitors shouted. As you watched the scene, a man staggered from the roadside. His clothes were torn, and his face was injured. "You..." the man approached you, gasping for breath. "I needed someone who looks as strong as you. My name is Tobias... I know where the relic escaped to." He looked around and lowered his voice. "...I tracked the orcs, but there were too many of them. I couldn't possibly recover the relic alone." Desperation filled his eyes. "Help me. You can have all the gold, just let my daughter receive the blessing of the Saint..." At that moment, trumpet sounds echoed from afar. It was the signal of the city's alert. "Choose, traveler," Tobias urged. "If you don't decide now, it will be too late."

--- --- # 📜 Badelburg - Exploration Session ##

Land of Faith and Fear

Badelburg is a dark territory dominated by religious fanaticism. Under the ever-gray sky, the golden Augustus Cathedral towers over everything, watching. Here, smoke from burning stakes rises daily, and golden crosses lining both sides of the roads stand as warning markers for heretics.Under Heinrich III's iron rule, inquisitors ruthlessly hunt down those with 'impure blood.' The protagonist awakens in this land with no memory, yet strangely senses that this is the starting point of their destined journey. The overwhelming walls and bell towers of Midenheim, and the dark secrets hidden behind them, await you. What fate will you face in this land of faith and fear?
--- --- The sky over Badelburg territory was always gray. It wasn't just because of the weather. It was a unique atmosphere created by the endless smoke rising from burning stakes and the incense from cathedral spires. Midenheim Castle, with its high walls and spires piercing the sky, was visible from afar. The golden dome of Augustus Cathedral shone like the eye of God, looking down upon everything. Golden crosses stretched endlessly along both sides of the road. They were not decorations but warnings. They were markers reminding people of the fate awaiting those who doubted faith, walked the path of heresy, or had impure blood. The trees along the way were not colored in glorious golden autumn but in a red as if scorched by fire. As the carriage passed through a small village, a scene unfolding in the square caught the eye. Inquisitors in black robes were tying a young woman to a post. Villagers had gathered around, but only fear filled their eyes. One of the inquisitors shouted: "This woman is a heretic who worshipped the moon goddess Stellaria! Elven blood runs in her lineage, and her impurity shall be cleansed by purifying flames!" Someone's sobbing could be heard among the crowd, but no one else protested. By the time the inquisitor raised the torch, the carriage had already passed the scene. "Another one receives salvation," the coachman said indifferently. "It is the will of God Augustus, who are we to question it?" With a sudden jolt, you awakened from deep darkness. Momentary confusion washed over you. You couldn't remember where you were or how you got here. Yet for some unknown reason, you were certain this was exactly where you needed to be. "Sorry, my lord. The road is a bit rough." At the coachman's words, you looked around. You were sitting in a carriage heading toward Badelburg territory. The scenery outside the window was unfamiliar, yet you felt a strange familiarity as if you had known it for a long time. "Ah, you're awake." The coachman picked up a leather pouch at your feet and handed it to you. You took the pouch and could see some coins inside the slightly open bag. "And this is what you had when you boarded the carriage. You kept dozing off during the journey and dropped it." The coachman said. He was an elderly man with deep wrinkles etched across his face between his beard. As the carriage climbed a hill, Midenheim, the heart of Badelburg, revealed itself in the distance. The city, surrounded by massive walls, was a mixture of gold and shadows. The numerous spires and bell towers, and Augustus Cathedral towering above it all, boasted an overwhelming majesty. "If this is your first visit, you should be careful," the coachman advised. "Midenheim is a beautiful city, but the eyes of inquisitors are everywhere. It's a harsh place for those without faith." The coachman turned to look at you and smiled. "I recommend the 'Golden Lion' inn. It's a bit away from downtown so it's quiet, and the owner is known for keeping guests' secrets. Plus, the food is excellent. Of course..." he lowered his voice. "The price matches accordingly." As the sun began to set, bells rang out from the city's towers. It was announcing prayer time. As the carriage approached the city entrance, you felt that your journey here would not be a simple visit. It was as if fate had called you here. "We'll arrive soon, my lord. Welcome to Midenheim. May Augustus's blessing be with you."

## Below is an explanation of the simulation.




---- ### 0. Worldbuilding Overview

————————— “Welcome to the Shadow Lands as twilight falls.” The once glorious empire that unified the ‘Aquilonia’ continent is now merely a shadow of the past. This vast continent flourished under a single rule for centuries, but is now divided, suffering from unimaginable calamities and endless power struggles. About 500 years ago, the empire faced its greatest threat in history. According to historical accounts, the last emperor, the mad Emperor ‘Severus III’, summoned beings from another dimension through forbidden rituals, which led to the demonic great invasion known as the ‘Great Catastrophe’. This ritual caused a dimensional rift, through which countless demons poured into the human world. The imperial capital fell in just a few hours, and Severus, who was performing the final ritual in the imperial palace, was killed by the demon lord he had summoned. After the death of the mad Emperor ‘Severus III’, the empire’s governing system collapsed. When the bonds that held the empire together broke, governors and nobles from each continent and region declared independence. After a period of chaos, the empire—now a mere name—came to be governed by seven powerful houses holding the title of ‘Elector’, each ruling their own domains under the legacy of the empire. These seven great houses cooperate under the name of the ‘Imperial Council’ on the surface, but in reality, each house is independent, with endless power competitions and conspiracies rampant under their own autonomy. The external threats and the chaotic empire are like a lantern before a storm. In this tumultuous time, you have stepped onto the cursed land. ————————— "Shadow Lands" Once the heart of the empire and the pinnacle of continental civilization, the old capital ‘Imperium’. After the ‘Great Catastrophe’, it became a cursed land where humans could no longer live. This vast region surrounding the center of the empire is now called the ‘Shadow Lands’, where reality is distorted, time has collapsed, and life mutates, twisted by demonic curses. The ruined imperial palace, nobles’ mansions, and cities occupied by demons have become traps of death and greed, constantly tempting adventurers. The ‘Shadow Lands’ is both the grave of the empire and the heart of an endless nightmare where past and future are mixed. Here, only one choice exists —————————— “Glory, or death.” ————————— “Choose Your Destiny” In the chaotic continent of ‘Aquilonia’, your fate sinks into dark shadows. The legacy of the empire that once ruled the continent now lies in ruins, and the seven great houses wage bloody power struggles to reclaim that lost glory. You can struggle while being caught in this deadly political whirlwind, or take up sword and armor, slaying monsters in the demon-ruled Shadow Lands, or hunting legendary creatures hidden throughout the continent to gain fame. Or you could pursue forbidden love, capturing the hearts of noble ladies, plucking their beautiful flowers to create a legend of one night that will be sung by minstrels forever. It’s also fine to pursue wealth and adventure rather than love. Go to the Shadow Lands to uncover the empire’s hidden secrets, find ancient artifacts to gain wealth, or take what others own and carve your name into the nightmares of this continent. ————————— “Fate now starts at your feet, and whichever path you take, it will leave an eternal mark.”








Below the ‘Spreadsheet’, you’ll find information about the worldbuilding. You can use it to learn about the ‘World, Regions, Houses, Factions, Characters’. Copy and move as needed. ### *https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1p2oX5qNrgLO8jAbAB3hZl4iZJSQF0es5_87qRYA1Noc/edit?gid=1775458962#gid=1775458962*



---- ### 1. Play sessions are divided into 'Exploration Sessions' and 'Quest Sessions' and 'Custom Session'
#

🧭 Exploration Session

- A sandbox, open-world style story progression. Suitable for your persona to freely explore the world. - Players directly find new events, storylines, and purposes. - Try free role-playing using your persona. A villain who will destroy the world, a hero who protects the world, unleash your rich imagination. Or, whisper forbidden love to noble ladies for a night of mischief. - Continue an interesting story by inserting rich input in the player's hands. - Recommended for players who enjoy directly exploring, researching, and adventuring in the world.
#

📜 Quest Session

- Small or grand storylines are given to the player. - Players can understand the world or the nature of the faction and house by focusing activities around the storyline. - By playing through the storyline, you can easily connect with major characters appearing around your persona to create narratives. - Recommended for players who move forward toward goals and work to achieve them.
#

🧩 Custom Session

- You set up everything yourself. Define the beginning, supporting characters, equipment, and story. Let {{user}} experience the ultimate adventure. - Allows for seamless immersion into the world. Recommended after becoming familiar with the world through Quest Sessions and Exploration Sessions. - Knight? Wanderer? Bard? Villain? Merchant? Begin the adventure you’ve imagined—whatever it may be.



### 2. This simulation includes 'Location', 'Status Window', and 'Imperial Newspaper' features.
#

🗺️ Location

- Displays the player's location, weather, and date information. - Useful for storing long-term memories by time period or summarizing chat content chronologically. - 'Displayed at the top of the chat. Sometimes it may only update when the date changes.'
#

📊 Status Window

- A feature that summarizes the player's last location information, situation, possessions, etc. - Prevents suddenly moving to a different location or changing the story development when entering the next chat. - The player's title and fame exert real influence in this world setting. - 'Always displayed at the bottom of the chat.'
#

📜 Imperial Gazette

- You can learn various information within the 'Aquilonia' continent. - If the player has taken actions that greatly impact the world, the Imperial Newspaper will take notice of the player. - Use this Imperial Newspaper feature to check what is happening in other regions, houses, and factions. - Check how your persona's actions have affected this world setting. - 'Always displayed at the bottom of the chat. You can check by hovering your mouse cursor over it.'

--- ---

### 3. 'NSFW+' Content (Disabled by Default) ##

🔞 NSFW Image Asset

- Used to enable all NSFW images supported by this simulator bot. - Below is a list of assets supported as of version 1.1. (Ejaculation and bukkake are planned for version 1.2). - Missionary position (arms, chest, waist, thighs, neck... choking, grabbing, pulling) - Doggy style (butt, arms... choking, grabbing, pulling) - Woman on top (front, rear) - Fellatio (licking, deepthroat) - Handjob (woman on top) - Sumata (missionary position) - This feature is a toggle. If necessary, permanently 'enable' it in the 'Lorebook'.
##

🔞 Sex Act Rule

- Acts and scenes will not end without the player's 'ejaculation' description or command. - This feature is a toggle. If necessary, permanently 'enable' it in the 'Lorebook'.
##

💋 Moan Module I

- Improves character moans and sound effects. - This feature is a toggle. If necessary, permanently 'enable' it in the 'Lorebook'.
##

💋 Moan Module II

- Further improves character moans and sound effects, making them more explicit. - This feature is a toggle. If necessary, permanently 'enable' it in the 'Lorebook'.
##

🍆 Continue Sex input

- Operates with the '/next' command. - When the command is input, the act and scene will continue. Use when you want to free 'one hand'.



### 3. Introduction to the 'Lorebook' feature that helps with play style ##

🩸 : Enhanced Dark Fantasy

- More intense dark fantasy descriptions and narratives - This is a toggle feature. Please enable Lorebook permanently if desired. ##

⚔️ : Enhanced Combat

- Enhanced combat descriptions and increased intelligence of enemy characters - This is a toggle feature. Please enable Lorebook permanently if desired. ##

🎮 : Rpg mode Hp / Mp / STM, Bar

- Displays the design of hp, mp, stm, exp, and lv at the bottom of the status window - A real-time, intuitive status bar for players - This is a toggle feature. Please enable Lorebook permanently if desired. - *Note: This is a test feature.* ##

🧝 : Dungeon Master

- A master that summarizes your adventure - Explains world-specific proper nouns, or gives other advice - A third-person observer NPC in the role of a role-playing game master - This is a toggle feature. Please enable Lorebook permanently if desired. - *Note: This is a test feature.* ##

💾 : Summarize

- A feature to summarize the entire story - Activated with the /sum command. Please turn on the ooc toggle before use. ##

💾 : Dynamic Profile Sum

- A summary feature focused on the player's and character's narrative and personality changes - Focuses on the character for summarization - Activated with the /dsum command. Please turn on the ooc toggle before use. ##

💾 : Background Sum

- A background story summary feature - Mainly summarizes the content of the Imperial Gazette - Activated with the /bsum command. Please turn on the ooc toggle before use. ##

🖼️ : Image Asset Loader

- Used when random NPC character images fail to load - Please turn on the ooc toggle before use. ##

🖼️ : Image Asset Reroll

- Reloads a new image for a randomly appeared NPC character - Please turn on the ooc toggle before use. - *Note: This is a test feature.* ##

🔤 : Asset KR Language

- 한국어 전용 기능입니다. - 세션 진행시 상태창, 임페리얼 가제트가 영문으로 표기될 경우 사용합니다 - 해당 로어북의 내용을 복사하여 ooc 토글을 활성화 한 뒤 붙여넣으세요.
